review: good movie. whoever made this knew how to make vampires scary. it's not that gory either so for those who don't like that stuff shouldn't have to worry about it. it felt pretty drawn out but it was fine with the plot. i definitely recommend this.

it‚Äôs a great and chilling movie about a town that has 30 days of no sunlight during winter got invaded by vampires. gory and violent; not for the faint hearted. not your typical lame vampire movie. josh hartnett is great in this one!
excellent movie! keeps you on the edge of your seat! vampires much better than fear the walking dead. these vampires are fast, sneaky, smart and blood thirsty. will definitely keep you entertained!

these vamps don't twinkle. they take over a town in alaska and go on a human-hunting spree when the sun goes down for months at a time. probably the only decent spiritual successor to nosferatu in that it depicts wholly inhuman vampires, not humans with colored contacts and cheap fangs. worth a watch if you want an intense vampire story.
loved it from start to finish! one of the best vampire films, (and plot), that i've seen in a long time! of course, i watch anything with josh hartnett in it!üíïhe is soooo easy on the eyes!üíï

this movie is a must watch if you like vampires. this movie is extremely good at making the vampires scary. and the vampire acting was on spot to especially that russian mob vampire. i was so scared whenever he did appear. just goggle "30 days of night vampire faces" that explains everything. i would rate this movie a 7.5/10.
this movie is intense, & keeps you on the edge of your seat thru the complete film. love the look of the vampires & it's thought out well & really deserves 10 stars. good job üëçüèΩ

okay and too boring.

an alaskan town experiences darkness for a month each year. after the last rays of light fade, a group of vicious vampires attacks the town. a couple stands between the vampires and the survivors.
are there little things about this movie that kinda make you go "hmm?"  sure.  but all in all, it's an awesomely scary movie.  worth the watch for sure.

one of the very few vampires movie that really gave me the chills. normally i don't like the animalistic version of them, but this time the interpretation of the myth turned out very well. just the ending didn't really satisfy me in full, but in the complex is a good movie.

the setting and tone of the movie provide a wonderful sense of immersion.
there isn't a single scene that doesn't capture the terror that the characters are enduring.

i don‚Äôt care what anyone says, josh hartnett and company did one hell of a performance. this film not only broke the bounds of what we expected but it rewrote the rules on vampires and cinema films.
